info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 4:30PM EDT until May 24 at 9:12AM EDT by NWS Boston/Norton MA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Rhode Island...
Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties.
For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Pawtuxet River at Cranston.
* WHEN...From Friday morning to late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Parking lots and roads are flooded in low lying areas of Warwick and Cranston near the Pawtuxet River. Impacted roads include River Street, Pioneer Avenue, Bellows Street and Venturi Avenue in Warwick.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 9.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING
